p: Following ordination of the six narrative elements using PCA, PC1 served as our index of narrativity, and was significantly correlated with log(citations) (R 2 = 0.05, p = 10 −9; Fig 1). PC1 (Narrativity index) varied significantly among journals (p = 10 −15), and correlated strongly and positively with log journal impact factor (R 2 = 0.62, p = 6 x 10 −5; carried out on PC1 journal means to avoid pseudoreplication), such that higher-impact journals tended to have more narrative articles ( Fig 2).
